title: An Unopened 2007 iPhone Can Be Yours (for $32,000 or More)
description: A first-generation Apple smartphone is going up for auction.

title: As Washington Calls for TikTok Ban, Its Owner Begins Pushing a New App
description: ByteDance, the Chinese company behind TikTok, is trying to woo popular social media creators to join its new app, Lemon8, before it is officially introduced this year.

title: What Makes Chatbots ‘Hallucinate’ or Say the Wrong Thing?
description: The curious case of the hallucinating software.

title: Elon Musk and Others Call for Pause on A.I., Citing ‘Risks to Society’
description: More than 1,000 tech leaders, researchers and others signed an open letter that urged a moratorium on the development of the most powerful artificial intelligence systems.

title: How ChatGPT and Bard Performed as My Executive Assistants
description: Google’s Bard chatbot fared far worse than OpenAI’s ChatGPT, but human assistants might soon be out of their jobs.

title: Rift Between Gaming Giants Shows Toll of China’s Economic Crackdown
description: Activision Blizzard and NetEase could not agree on a new deal to distribute video games in China, cutting millions of players from the games in January.
